gameutils.gameworld
Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
  gameutils.gameworld.GameWorld
All Implemented Interfaces:
Screen
public class GameWorld
extends Object
implements Screen

A GameWorld is a container of Entities. It has a z-buffer that goes in back-to-front order, 0 being the back.

Author:
Roi Atalla

setBackground

public void setBackground(String s)
Sets the background of this GameWorld with an image in Art.

Parameters:
s - The associated name of an image in Art. This image will be drawn before all other Entities.

setBackground

public void setBackground(Image bg)
Sets the background of this GameWorld. A compatible image is created.

Parameters:
bg - The image to be drawn before all other Entities.

setBackground

public void setBackground(Color color)
Sets the background to the specified color. This method creates a 1x1 image with the specified color and stretches it to the width and height of the parent.

Parameters:
color - The color to be used as the entire background. It will be drawn before all other Entities.

getBackgroundImage

public Image getBackgroundImage()
Returns the background image.

Returns:
The image used as the background.

size

public int size()
Returns:
The total number of Entities in this world.

Returns:
The width of this world.
